column4: hey guys, im trying to remove tspc from my computer, and im running into a problem....it wont uninstall, heres the output: http://paste.ubuntu.com/139509/
did you try to stop the service manually?
and did you succeed?
that was the output when i stopped it manually, and then tried to uninstall it
the output there is of the purge command, and it says that it failed to stop the server...
did you try using synaptic instead?
no, it is a headless server that i am ssh-ing into
this is the output when i try to stop it manually first, then purge it http://paste.ubuntu.com/139513/
hmmm, I am sorry I do not know about that
I think the stop command hadn't completed before you started to purge the package, and the stop command failed midway while doing so for whatever reasons
I see.....so should I try to stop it again, and wait for a while before I do the purge command?
I would suggest that
this is what I have:umer@server:~$ sudo /etc/init.d/tspc stop
wait a lil more till you get success or failure...
any luck?
still waiting, no change
hmmmm
I know, its confusing
yes...maybe you will have to go offline or something to forcefully stop it or something...or maybe someone with more insight should speak up, why don't you ask the problem again
what do you mean go offline?
I meant that you perhaps disconnect
